result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Lee Tolbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve 9  MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 (two) days served; Huber privileges for work, school, and AODA treatment.  

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 years with the following conditions:
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Dosage Probation program - providing he is accepted into the program and successfully completes the program; probation may be terminated early.
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- No violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- Breathalyzers
- Cognitive Thinking/Behavior Modification Program
- Employment and/or School
- Any other treatment or programs recommended by the agent
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
- No driver license suspension

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Ronald Lee Tolbert in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files Amended Information with the court:
Count 1:  Possession Of THC (Tetrahydrocannabinols) - 2nd And Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. Sec. 961.41(3g)(e), 939.50(3)(i)

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Ronald Lee Tolbert in court with attorney Patrick J Rupich.  Kevin R Shomin for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Rupich license was suspended due to CLE credits.  Attorney Rupich gave the defendant a choice of either obtaining new counsel or waiting until he is reinstated.  Defendant wishes to have new counsel.  Attorney Rupich moves to withdraw.  Discovery was turned over to defendant.  Court grants motion and allows attorney to withdraw subject to public defender's office appointing new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald Lee Tolbert in court.  William Levins appeared for Nathaniel Adamson for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Ruprich is suspended.  Court adjourns case for scheduling conference.   Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notification of Suspension letter received and filed./ds

Defendant Ronald Lee Tolbert in court with attorney Patrick J Rupich.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered him not to possess or use any illegal drugs.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronald Lee Tolbert in court with attorney Patrick J Rupich.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
